August 5, 2016

Are you the leader we are looking for? NCE Steering Committee is seeking Candidate

The National Conference of Executives (NCE) of The Arc is seeking candidates to serve on its Steering Committee for a two-year term beginning in 2017. To learn what’s involved, please review the NCE Steering Committee Prospectus which you can find here. To apply, please complete the online application by the end of August. The window for applying to serve on the NCE Steering Committee is about to close and won’t re-open for two years! So how about throwing your hat into the ring? Your colleagues in NCE need you! Questions – contact Peter Berns at berns@thearc.org or Tim Hornbecker at timothyhornbecker@arcalameda.org.

NCE Summer Leadership Institute, a Recap from Kathleen Stauffer

As your New England Regional NCE Rep, let me fill you in on our incredible July 18-20 NCE Summer Leadership Institute in Palm Springs, CA. This year’ event, titled Community for All – Our Promise, Our Challenge offered dynamic and inspiring ideas for community organizing, keeping one step ahead of sexual predators, shutting down sheltered workshops, housing solutions, planned giving and more!

Networking also was a hit as our new attendees – a steadily growing number – continue to add to the energy of the conference. For R & R, a ride into the San Jacinto Mountains via the Palm Springs Aerial Tram followed by a farm-to-table dinner ensured a little time to talk shop and to relax. Our planning team from NCE certainly lined up a winning and dynamic program.

If you couldn’t be there in person, you do not have to miss out! Archived presentations are available on the NCE Sumer Leadership Institute Website. From the homepage, click on schedule, and the title of the individual sessions that you wish to download. Here is a direct link to the full schedule: http://nce-sli.org/schedule/

If you have attended the Summer Leadership Institute, now is the time to share your feedback. Please complete our evaluation here

Experience the Magic of the Professional Development Seminar

NCE is proud to bring you the Disney Institute’s Approach to Leadership Excellence as this year’s NCE Professional Development Seminar in Orlando, FL. On the first half day, Disney will share its institutional expertise in:

  • Reconciling organizational tension
  • Intention vs. behaviors
  • The importance of teams
  • Measuring values against performance

On the second half day, we will put our new knowledge to use by forming action plans around case studies that relate to the topics above. The content from these case studies comes directly from your first hand experiences. This two-day event is truly not to be missed. Register today!

Apply for a Professional Development Seminar Scholarship!

This year, we are pleased to offer two types of scholarships for the NCE Professional Development Seminar, scheduled for October 26-27th at the Hilton Orlando Lake Buena Vista during The Arc’s National Convention.

The first is for first time attending Chapter Executive Directors/CEOs. The second is for our first time attending “Next Generation Leaders,” who have been in the IDD field for at least three years. Scholarships will cover:

  • Registration
  • Attendance at the NCE Awards Ceremony and Luncheon

Awardees will be responsible for their own transportation and hotel expenses. Applications will be accepted until August 19th.

Click here to apply today.

Save the Date for the NCE Award Ceremony and Luncheon

The NCE Distinguished Professional Awards Ceremony will take place during the National Convention on October 27th 12:30-2:00pm at the Hilton Orlando Lake Buena Vista. Please join us as we spotlight the professionals who have fulfilled the values, mission, and position statements of The Arc.

This year, we have expanded the categories of awards offered to create new opportunities to celebrate NCE members’ achievements. Come, and join us as we acknowledge the inaugural recipients of the:
  • Diversity and Cultural Competency Award, for CEOs who have established innovative program(s) that meet the needs of a diverse I/DD community
  • Exemplary Career Leadership Award, for retiring CEOs
  • Exemplary Mentor Award, for CEOs who have mentored NCE members
  • Program Innovation Award, CEOs who have implemented innovative programs

It’s Never Too Late to Donate to the NCE Silent Auction

Thank you to those who contributed an item to our Silent Auction campaign Bigger! Better! More! at this year’s Summer Leadership Institute. We have a couple of months before the NCE Silent Auction at The Arc’s Convention in Orlando, FL, so you still have a chance to contribute an item that will help send our chapter leaders and staff who have never attended SLI or the Professional Development Seminar to these events.

Complete our online form to donate an item. If you have any questions, contact Laura Rahman, Director of Individual Philanthropy, at rahman@thearc.org.

Martin Luther King, Jr. Day 2017 Grant: Have you submitted your proposal yet?

For the second year, The Arc is working with the Corporation for National and Community Service to offer $10,000 grants to chapters of The Arc to develop service projects that commemorate Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. During the projects, people with I/DD will volunteer alongside people without disabilities to provide food assistance to people in need in their community. See how our 2016 participating chapters commemorated the 2016 MLK Day of Service and check out their pictures! Requests for Proposals are due August 19, 2016. Questions? Contact Jennifer Sladen.
